cont.entity_a: Easy to load with a flip open one-piece side.

cont.entity_b: Powerful and well thought out nailer.
Heavy but can be heavy in handling.

cont.entity_a: One jam in the entire roof was easily cleared. Only jammed once in a week of heavy use.
Simple depth adjustment needed only once. No tool required for depth adjustment. Easy to adjust the nail depth on the fly.
cont.entity_b: Depth adjustment resets to max depth at random.

cont.entity_a: Used Bostitch nails which fit well and fired regularly. Consistent driving performance with 1-1/4 inch Bostitch nails at 85 psig.
cont.entity_b: Shoots many different size nails from various manufacturers. Generally, nail head goes just beneath the wood.

cont.entity_a: The grip is good, and the weight and handling are excellent.
cont.entity_b: Balanced well and comfortable to use despite initial size concerns.

cont.entity_a: The gun failed after about 12 shingles; Bostitch covered shipping for repair.
The castings are of good quality and lightweight.
cont.entity_b: Framing hook is plastic and seems flimsy. Head is large and awkward between standard 16" center studs.

cont.entity_a: Works great with bump mode. No misfires or odd quirks.
cont.entity_b: Dual purpose for framing and metal connector use. Allows installation of metal hardware like hurricane ties efficiently.

cont.entity_a: The gun failed after about 12 shingles; Bostitch covered shipping for repair.
cont.entity_b: Nail guide fell out, requiring repair under warranty.
